mainBoard.flavorText: These spirits of the air are winsome and wild and cannot be truly contained. Only marginally intelligent, they often substitute whimsy for strategy, delighting in mischief and mayhem.
mainBoard.name: Air Elemental
mainBoard.originalText: Flying
mainBoard.text: Flying

mainBoard.flavorText:
Little dreamt could seem so cruel
As waiting for the wings outspread,
The jagged teeth, the burning eyes,
And dagger-claws that clench to nerves.
mainBoard.name: Azure Drake
mainBoard.originalText: Flying
mainBoard.text: Flying

—Ib Halfheart, goblin tactician

mainBoard.name: Infantry Veteran
mainBoard.originalText:
oc
T: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: An “attacking creature” is one that has been declared as an attacker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield attacking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be an attacking creature through the end of combat step, even if the player it was attacking has left the game, or the planeswalker it was attacking has left combat.

mainBoard.text: {T}: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch."
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher
mainBoard.name: Man-o'-War
mainBoard.originalText: When Man-o'-War comes into play, return target creature to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: If there are no other creatures on the battlefield when Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, its ability must target itself.

mainBoard.text: When Man-o'-War enters, return target creature to its owner's hand.

mainBoard.flavorText: Occasionally members of the Institute of Arcane Study acquire a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.

mainBoard.flavorText: The true names of birds are songs woven into their souls.

mainBoard.flavorText:
Count carefully the souls and see that none are lost.
—Vec teaching
mainBoard.name: Soul Warden
mainBoard.originalText: Whenever another creature comes into play, you gain 1 life.

rulings.text: Does not trigger on a card on the battlefield being changed into a creature.
The ability will not trigger on itself entering, but it will trigger on any other creature that is put onto the battlefield at the same time.
Two Soul Wardens entering at the same time will each cause the other's ability to trigger.

mainBoard.text: Whenever another creature enters, you gain 1 life.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"No bird soars too high, if he soars with his own wings."
—William Blake,
*The Marriage of Heaven and Hell*

mainBoard.originalText: Each player discards his or her hand and draws cards equal to the greatest number a player discarded this way.
mainBoard.text: Each player discards their hand, then draws cards equal to the greatest number of cards a player discarded this way.

mainBoard.name: Curfew
mainBoard.originalText: Each player returns a creature he or she controls to its owner's hand.
mainBoard.text: Each player returns a creature they control to its owner's hand.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"I implore you not to forget the horrors of the past. You would have us start the Brothers' War anew!"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic
mainBoard.name: Disenchant
mainBoard.originalText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

rulings.text: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

mainBoard.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

—Volrath

—Barrin, master wizard

mainBoard.name: Ray of Command
mainBoard.originalText:
Untap target creature an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. (It may attack and oc
T the turn it comes under your control.)

rulings.text: The creature returns to the opponent when the “until end of turn” effect wears off during the cleanup step. It taps during the Cleanup step (if it is not already tapped), so any abilities triggered off it tapping happen at that time.
You may target an untapped creature with Ray of Command.
You tap the creature when you lose control of it for any reason — because Ray of Command’s effect ends, or because a spell or ability causes another player to gain control of it.

mainBoard.text: Untap target creature an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. When you lose control of the creature, tap it.

mainBoard.name: Swords to Plowshares
mainBoard.originalText: Remove target creature from the game. Its controller gains life equal to its power.

rulings.text: Use the power of the creature from when it was last on the battlefield to determine how much life is gained.

mainBoard.text: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.

mainBoard.name: Control Magic
mainBoard.originalText: You control enchanted creature.

rulings.text: Gaining control of a creature doesn't cause you to gain control of any Auras or Equipment attached to it.
